required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Single Arm Trial With Resolute Onyx in ONE-Month DAPT for High-Bleeding Risk Patients Who Are Considered One-Month Clear (Onyx ONE Clear)
clinical_study.official_title: Onyx ONE Clear: A Single Arm Trial With Resolute Onyx in ONE-Month DAPT for High-Bleeding Risk Patients Who Are Considered One-Month Clear (Onyx ONE Clear)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this trial is to evaluate the clinical safety and effectiveness of the Resolute Onyx stent in subjects deemed at high risk for bleeding and/or medically unsuitable for more than 1 month DAPT treatment receiving reduced duration (1 month) of DAPT following stent implantation.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Prospective, multi-center, single arm trial enrolling eligible subjects in the United States and Japan. Subjects will remain in the study with follow-up clinical assessments through 2 years, study exit, or death, whichever comes first.

primary_outcome.measure: Composite endpoint: Cardiac Death and Myocardial Infarction [Time Frame: One year post procedure]
primary_outcome.description: Composite of cardiac death and myocardial infarction at one year for a one-month clear population [Time Frame: One month to one year]

secondary_outcome.description: Defined as cardiac death, target vessel myocardial infarction (Q wave and non Q wave), or clinically driven target lesion revascularization(TLR) by percutaneous or surgical method
Attainment of <30% residual stenosis by QCA (or <20% by visual assessment) AND TIMI flow 3 after the procedure, using any percutaneous method without the occurrence of MACE during the hospital stay.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients with Cardiac Death
Number of Patients with Major Cardiac Event
secondary_outcome.description: Major adverse cardiac event (MACE) defined as composite of death, myocardial infarction, or repeat target lesion revascularization (clinically driven) by percutaneous or surgical methods

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients with Myocardial Infarction
secondary_outcome.description: All myocardial infarction including Target Vessel Myocardial Infarction (TVMI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients with Target Vessel Failure
secondary_outcome.description: Target vessel failure (TVF) defined as composite of cardiac death, target vessel myocardial infarction, or clinically-driven target vessel revascularization (TVR) by percutaneous or surgical methods.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients with Stent Thrombosis
secondary_outcome.description: Stent thrombosis (per Academic Research Consortium (ARC) definition)
The attainment of <30% residual stenosis by QCA (or < 20% by visual assessment) AND TIMI flow 3 after the procedure, using any percutaneous method
Attainment of <30% residual stenosis by QCA (or <20% by visual assessment) AND TIMI flow 3 after the procedure, using the assigned device only.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Medtronic Resolute Onyx Zotarolimus-Eluting Coronary Stent
arm_group.description: Subjects who fulfill the inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria will be treated with a Resolute Onyx stent followed by one-month DAPT. The clinical safety of the Resolute Onyx stent as compared to a performance goal will be evaluated using a composite safety endpoint of cardiac death and myocardial infarction at 1 year for a one-month clear population.

intervention.intervention_name: Device: Medtronic Resolute Onyx Zotarolimus-Eluting Coronary Stent System Treatment Followed by one-month DAPT
intervention.description: To evaluate the clinical safety of the Resolute Onyx stent with use of one-month DAPT in subjects deemed at high risk for bleeding and/or medically unsuitable for more than one-month DAPT treatment.
intervention.arm_group_label: Medtronic Resolute Onyx Zotarolimus-Eluting Coronary Stent

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥ 75 years old
- Any prior documented intracerebral bleed
- Any documented stroke in the last 12 months
- Hospital admission for bleeding during the prior 12 months
- Renal failure defined as: Creatinine clearance <40 ml/min
- Thrombocytopenia (PLT <100,000/mm3)
- Severe chronic liver disease defined as: subjects who have developed any of the following: variceal hemorrhage, ascites, hepatic encephalopathy or jaundice
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant and breastfeeding women
- Subjects requiring a planned PCI procedure after 1 month of index procedure
- Active bleeding at the time of inclusion
- Cardiogenic shock
- A known hypersensitivity or contraindication to aspirin, heparin and bivalirudin, P2Y12 inhibitors, mTOR inhibiting drugs such as zotarolimus, Biolimus A9 (or its derivatives), cobalt, nickel, platinum, iridium, chromium, molybdenum, polymer coatings (eg, BioLinx™), stainless steel (or other metal ions found in 316L stainless steel), zinc, or a sensitivity to contrast media, which cannot be adequately pre-medicated.
- PCI during the previous 6 months for a lesion other than the target lesion of the index procedure
- Participation in another clinical study within 12 months after index procedure
- Subjects with life expectancy of less than 2 years

overall_official.affiliation: New York-Presbyterian Hospital/Columbia University Medical Center, New York, NY

facility.name: New York- Presbyterian Hospital/Columbia University Medical Center
